sub_topic: Identifying the perfect matching in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph (G) with 6 vertices and 8 edges:

      1 - 2
      | / |
      3 - 4
      |   |
      5 - 6
      
What is the maximum number of perfect matchings possible in graph (G)?
message_2:
A perfect matching is a set of edges such that every vertex is connected to exactly one other vertex in the set, and no two edges share a vertex.

In graph (G), we can find the following perfect matchings:

1. (1-2), (3-4), (5-6)
2. (1-3), (2-4), (5-6)
3. (1-4), (2-3), (5-6)

So, the maximum number of perfect matchings possible in graph (G) is 3.
